doc.title: Hash

value.content: The hash function takes a variable-length message input and produces a fixed-length hash output. It is commonly in the form of a 128-bit "fingerprint" or "message digest". Hashes are very useful for cryptography — they insure the integrity of transmitted data, and provide the basis for HMAC, which enables message authentication.

value.title: See also
value.content: • Hash function on Wikipedia
